title: i really do like Liandry's Torment but i honestly don't feel it's worth it
body:
most cases if not _all_ i keep finding that the burn damage, is close to not noticeable, sometimes i even burn full health enemies in ticks of 3s!

now take a look at it's counterpart, the Blade of the Ruined King, which fits ANY As relient champion, and the constant hits, deals far more damage than what you would've with a Liandry's

now don't get me wrong, i love the burn it gives, it's the only item that gives a DoT, but i feel i pay a bit _too_ much for that small burn

i'd really really like to have a smaller item that gives the same DoT, but like, cheaper! with LESS AP, and MORE Magic Pent

i feel like it has alot of stats, but they're all small ones, and just don't work on any champion

lately i've been using it on Sej and Nautilus, and buy it immediatly after cinderhulk if i was ahead, and honestly, i still feel like i could've done SO MUCH better if i just gone with abyssal specter





Edit: as of some of you suggested, having a minimal damage Threshold might be the way to go, atleast this way you don't feel that bad about buying it

if your opponent is at 1 health and there is still another application of damage from the dot it will kill them. It rounds up not down and cannot deal less than 1 damage.

I've seen it tick for 0 against ranged squishies with no MR items when I was fully specc'd for magic pen

liandri's is actually conflicted atm. it has flat magic pen (which is great for squishies) and a %hp dot (which is great for tank shredding)

The problem, however, is that the magic pen is invaluable on certain mages, despite them not optimally using the burn.

My suggestion is to give haunting guise a new item to build into with just flat magic pen and no burn, and give liandri's a slightly stronger burn, a little more hp, little more ap, and a magic resist shred that stacks with each tick of the dot. (like 2% MR shred per stack, stacks up to X times, after Y secs stacks are lost) this way, it's still great for dot mages, and also becomes a solid pick on ap bruisers or poke mages allowing for more reason to kill the off tank or create more tension in order to force the enemy to make a move in a siege respectively.

Most of the complaints against the burn is that it only does 2-4% of an enemy's current hp. Yeah, 2-4% isn't all that impressive ... until you stop thinking about 1v1s and look at teamfights. Champions with long-range aoe abilities (*cough* {{champion:143}} *cough*) can easily get that burn on multiple enemies at a time. Hit the entire team with your ult? Suddenly you're burning 10-20% of their collective hp ... **every second!** Liandry's is the main reason that Zyra regularly gets highest damage to champions - even from the support role.

And yes, the burn doesn't do very much at low hp, but that's not the point. The burn isn't supposed to finish kills ... it's meant to get an enemy low enough that a carry/assassin can finish the kill.

Your wording is very poor/misleading. If 2-4% of an enemies HP is taken, hitting more may multiply the damage, but it doesn't collectively increase in percentage; the collective damage is still going to be 2-4%. What you're meaning to say is that it essentially multiplies the damage by the number of targets hit, so it's potentially more effective for AoE champions.

One of the reason Zyra deals so much damage is because she deals AoE damage and also because she deals sustained damage with her plants and decently short cooldown on her Q (well at least when it is leveled up)
And because she has pretty high base damages

And the burn will never deal full damage after all the ability you hit the enemy with will deal damage and lower their HP and also the burn itself will also slightly lower their HP

Though of course it works rather well if you just toss a DoT on the enemy and that's it.. just to harass them (especially if the DoT ticks very quickly, last a long time or have a slowing effect.... and this is the reason brand DoT was changed to tick fewer times but still dealing the same damage)

Yeah its pretty niche, its only really good as a single offensive item on Tanks, or on certain DoT mages. The difference in pre-liandries and post-liandries damage from a single {{champion:69}} Q on a tank is VERY noticeable.

Personally I would love it if Haunting Guise also went into something more stats heavy AS WELL as the passive option.
this item is op whn you have rylai, it's useless if you don't have it. This item should be reworked.

It's best used on champions who have their own crowd control and damage over time, even better if they have both (read: Fiddlesticks, Malzahar, Teemo, Nautilus, Sejuani, Rammus, Brand, Azir, Heimerdinger, Cassiopeia, Katarina, Morgana, Vel'koz, and Rumble among others I forget). It's powerful enough as-is, and it's meant to compliment your main source of power, not be the main source of your power.
I thought liandry's was just supposed to be a super late game item so you can have haunting guise in your build the whole game and have the satisfaction of a third tier item.

Problem is... if they buff it or make a true item mages can use to do damage to tanks, they'd have to nerf champions like {{champion:7}} or {{champion:1}}  and God forbid Riot ever nerfing such champions.
why not SLIGHTLY change it's passive 2% of current hp/second down to a minimum of 15 hp/second might seem kinda low but it will help with killing anyone who lives at low hp.

I feel like the item is fine, and its stats make sense when you realize what it actually is; it's a poking item for AP mids that kite alot, like Vel'koz, and for those that have lots of DOT's, like Malzahar or Brand. It is also a solid item on AP tanks that do lots of AOE damage over time, such as Sejuani, Zac, or Mundo. The magic pen and burn makes you do considerably more to enemy squishies, and the burn damage does significant damage to tanks as well, just over a longer period of time. The item isn't meant to actually finish enemies, it's meant to wear them down to the point to where you are another damage dealer on your team can go in for the kill.

Liandry's Torment {{item:3151}} is extremely potent on some champions and abilities, like {{champion:17}} Teemo shrooms, but definitely lacks that punch it feels it should have when the enemy is low. I think that the problem lies in it's %currentHP burn. Honestly, by now we *probably* have the technology to make Liandry's do something along the lines of "burns %currentHP unless enemy unit has less than 20% HP, then it burns a lower %maxHP amount", but the item is old and probably hasn't been really looked at in years.
Riot themselves very recently (In the black cleaver discussion) stated that Liandries suffers from the same problems old black cleaver did, and that they really wish to change it.
I think it should have a boost in burn damage if the target it is burning is above half-health.

I think liandries counterpart is Black cleaver and not BRK. Ad/Ap, penetration, Hp. It's made for Ap tanks and fighters. 

The liandries passive is the opposite of what you want for most mages. It's stronger when you burn slowly the enemy when mage burst most of the time.

Even if the %hp damage make you feel like it's an Hp stack counter, I think it's barely the case.
It's really good on Teemo in particular. People tend to underestimate how much Liandrys+Poison+Ignite really does.
